definitions: cause someone to know about or become familiar with a person or thing
examples: Let me acquaint you with the new office procedures
She acquainted herself with the local customs before traveling

definitions: accept something reluctantly but without protest or argument even though you may disagree
examples: She acquiesced to her parents' wishes about college choice
The board finally acquiesced to the CEO's expansion plans

definitions: officially declare someone not guilty of a criminal charge after a trial
conduct oneself or perform in a particular way in a situation
examples: The jury acquitted the defendant of all charges yesterday
The evidence was insufficient to convict so they acquitted her
He acquitted himself well during the difficult interview process
The new employee acquitted herself admirably on her first project

definitions: cause something to start working or become active and ready for use
examples: Press this button to activate the emergency alarm system
You need to activate your credit card before using it

definitions: cause someone to become physically or psychologically dependent on a particular substance or activity
examples: Video games can addict children if parents don't monitor usage
The painkillers addicted him within just a few months

definitions: stick fast to a surface or substance physically through glue or similar means
believe in and follow practices, rules, or beliefs consistently and faithfully
examples: The label won't adhere properly to the wet bottle surface
Make sure the tiles adhere completely before walking on them
All employees must adhere to the company dress code policy
She adheres strictly to her morning meditation routine

definitions: be next to and joined with another building, room, or piece of land
examples: Our property adjoins the national park on the eastern side
The master bedroom adjoins a large walk-in closet

definitions: break off a meeting or legal proceeding with the intention of resuming it later
examples: The judge adjourned the trial until Monday morning
Let's adjourn this meeting and reconvene after lunch

definitions: make a formal judgment or decision about a problem or disputed matter as a judge
examples: The court will adjudicate the dispute between the two companies
A panel of experts will adjudicate the competition entries

definitions: love and respect someone deeply with great affection and tenderness
worship and honor as a deity or as something divine
examples: She absolutely adores her grandchildren and spoils them constantly
He adores his wife even after thirty years of marriage
The ancient Greeks adored many gods and built temples for them
Some cultures adore the sun as a life-giving deity

definitions: make more beautiful or attractive by adding decorative items or features to something
examples: She adorned her hair with fresh flowers for the wedding
Beautiful paintings adorn the walls of the historic mansion

definitions: refer to something briefly or indirectly in speaking or writing without discussing in detail
examples: The speaker adverted to the recent scandal only briefly
She adverted to her childhood experiences in the interview

definitions: describe or draw attention to a product or service in public to promote sales
make something known publicly or generally to inform people about it
examples: The company advertises its new products on social media platforms
They advertise heavily during the holiday shopping season
The job opening was advertised in several major newspapers
Don't advertise your wealth in unsafe neighborhoods

definitions: officially attach or connect a subsidiary group or person to a larger organization
examples: The local club decided to affiliate with the national organization
Many universities affiliate with hospitals for medical training programs

definitions: state something as a fact strongly and publicly with confidence
offer emotional support or encouragement to someone to validate their worth
examples: She affirmed her commitment to the environmental protection cause
The witness affirmed that she saw the accident happen
Good teachers affirm their students' efforts and build their confidence
He affirmed her decision to change careers

definitions: stick, attach, or fasten something to something else in a permanent way
examples: Please affix your signature at the bottom of the document
She affixed the stamp carefully to the envelope corner

definitions: insult or offend someone openly by showing disrespect through words or actions
examples: His rude comments affronted everyone at the dinner party
She felt affronted by their decision to exclude her

definitions: make a problem, injury, or offense worse or more serious than before
annoy or irritate someone persistently through repeated actions or behavior
examples: Scratching will only aggravate the mosquito bite further
The heavy rain aggravated the flooding situation downtown
Her constant complaints really aggravate her coworkers
Loud music late at night aggravates the neighbors

definitions: combine several things into a single group or total amount
examples: The website aggregates news stories from multiple sources worldwide
We need to aggregate all the sales data for analysis

definitions: stir or shake something vigorously especially a liquid to mix it
make someone troubled, nervous, or upset about something
campaign energetically in public to bring about political or social change
examples: Agitate the solution for thirty seconds before adding catalyst
The washing machine agitates clothes to remove dirt
The bad news clearly agitated him for the entire day
Don't agitate the baby right before bedtime
Workers agitated for better wages and safer working conditions
She agitated for women's voting rights throughout her life

definitions: cause pain, illness, or trouble to someone physically or mentally
examples: Something has been ailing grandfather for several weeks now
What ails you that you look so sad today

definitions: transport supplies or personnel by aircraft especially to or from an inaccessible area
examples: The military airlifted food supplies to the flood victims
Rescue teams airlifted the injured hikers from the mountain

definitions: send mail or packages by aircraft for faster delivery than regular postal service
examples: Please airmail this package to arrive by next week
I always airmail birthday cards to my overseas relatives

definitions: warn someone of a danger, threat, or problem requiring immediate attention
examples: The weather service alerted residents about the approaching hurricane
Security guards alerted police when they noticed suspicious activity

definitions: provide an excuse or defense for someone especially by proving they were elsewhere
examples: His wife alibied him by confirming he was home all evening
She tried to alibi her absence with a doctor's note

definitions: cause someone to feel isolated, estranged, or hostile by unfriendly behavior or circumstances
examples: His arrogant attitude alienated most of his former friends
The new policies alienated many long-time customers

definitions: descend from a train, bus, or other form of transport
descend from the air and settle gently on a surface
examples: Passengers may alight at the next station for museum access
She alighted from the taxi in front of the hotel
The butterfly alighted briefly on the flower before flying away
Several birds alighted on the telephone wire

definitions: diminish or put at rest fear, suspicion, or worry about something troubling
examples: The doctor allayed her fears about the medical procedure
His calm explanation helped allay their concerns

definitions: claim or assert that someone has done something illegal or wrong without providing proof
examples: The newspaper alleges corruption in the city government
He alleged that his neighbor damaged his property deliberately

definitions: make suffering, deficiency, or a problem less severe without removing the cause entirely
examples: This medicine should alleviate your headache within an hour
The new program aims to alleviate poverty in rural areas

definitions: distribute resources or duties for a particular purpose according to a plan
examples: The committee will allocate funds to various research projects
We need to allocate more time for testing phase

definitions: give or apportion something to someone as a share or task
examples: Each speaker was allotted fifteen minutes for their presentation
The teacher allotted specific tasks to each group member

definitions: take into consideration when planning by making provisions for particular circumstances
examples: You should allowance for traffic delays when planning arrival time
The budget must allowance for unexpected expenses

definitions: mix metals together to create a substance with enhanced properties
examples: They alloy copper with tin to create stronger bronze
Manufacturers alloy steel with chromium for rust resistance

definitions: suggest or call attention to indirectly or by hint rather than explicit reference
examples: She alluded to her difficult childhood without giving details
The poem alludes to several classical Greek myths

definitions: powerfully attract, charm, or tempt someone through beauty or other desirable qualities
examples: The promise of adventure allured him to join the expedition
Bright city lights allure many young people from rural areas

definitions: occur in turns repeatedly one after the other in a regular pattern
repeatedly switch between two or more things, states, or actions
examples: Day and night alternate in a twenty-four hour cycle
The guards alternate shifts every eight hours
She alternates between hope and despair about her future
Alternate between running and walking during your workout

definitions: combine or unite to form one organization, structure, or whole from separate parts
examples: The two companies will amalgamate to create a stronger corporation
Several small schools amalgamated into one large educational institution

definitions: gather together or accumulate a large amount or number of valuable things over time
examples: He amassed a fortune through smart real estate investments
She amassed an impressive collection of rare books

definitions: make a surprise attack on someone from a concealed position
examples: The rebels ambushed the convoy on the mountain road
Photographers ambushed the celebrity outside the restaurant

definitions: make something bad or unsatisfactory better through improvement or positive change
examples: New policies should ameliorate working conditions for factory employees
The medication helps ameliorate symptoms but doesn't cure disease

definitions: make minor changes to a text to make it fairer or more accurate
modify formally as in changing a law, document, or statement officially
examples: The editor amended several errors in the manuscript
She amended her earlier statement to clarify her position
Congress voted to amend the constitution regarding voting rights
The committee amended the proposal based on public feedback

definitions: grant an official pardon to a group of people especially for political offenses
examples: The government will amnesty political prisoners as part of reconciliation
The president amnestied all draft dodgers after the war

definitions: increase the volume of sound especially using electronic equipment
add details to a story or statement to make it clearer or more comprehensive
examples: The speakers amplify the singer's voice throughout the stadium
This device amplifies weak radio signals for better reception
Could you amplify your earlier comments about the project
She amplified her research findings during the presentation

definitions: provide interesting and enjoyable occupation for someone's time and attention
cause someone to find something funny and laugh or smile
examples: The clown's silly antics amused the children at the party
She amused herself by reading novels during the flight
His witty comments never fail to amuse the audience
The baby's expressions amused everyone in the room

definitions: rearrange the letters of a word or phrase to create a new word or phrase
examples: Can you anagram these letters into a meaningful word
She likes to anagram celebrity names for fun

definitions: examine something methodically and in detail to explain and interpret it
examples: Scientists analyse the data to understand climate change patterns
The detective will analyse all evidence from the crime scene

definitions: cause severe mental or physical pain and suffering to someone
examples: The tragic news anguished the entire family for months
It anguished him to see his homeland destroyed

definitions: bring to life or give vitality and spirit to something
create moving images from still drawings or models for film or video
examples: Her enthusiasm animates every conversation she joins
The speaker's passion animated the previously bored audience
Disney animates classic fairy tales for children's entertainment
The studio animates characters using advanced computer software

definitions: add territory to one's own territory by appropriation or take possession of it
add an extra or subordinate part especially to a building
examples: The city plans to annex the surrounding suburban areas
The country annexed its neighbor's coastal region after the war
They decided to annex a new wing to the hospital
We'll annex a garage to the main house
